sen.j: 西国筋郡代（さいごくすじぐんだい）とは、江戸時代に4ヶ所設置された郡代の一つ。
sen.e: Saigokusuji-gundai was one of the gundai set in four places in the Edo period.
Saigokusuji-gundai was one of the gundai set in four places in the Edo period.
Saigokusuji-gundai was one of the gundai set in four places in the Edo period.

sen.j: 西国郡代とも呼ばれる。
sen.e: It is also known as Saigoku-gundai.
It is also known as Saigoku-gundai.
It is also known as Saigoku-gundai.

sen.j: 九州の徳川幕府直轄領の民治を司る行政官であり代官であり、16万2千石を所轄する。
sen.e: Saigokusuji-gundai, an executive officer as well as a local governor who managed the affairs of Kyushu region where was the territory under the direct control of the Tokugawa shogunate, had a fief of 162,000 koku.

Saigokusuji-gundai, an administrative officer as well as a local governor who managed the affairs of Kyushu region which was the territory under the direct control of the Tokugawa shogunate, had a fief of 162,000 koku.
sen.cmt: 「executive officer」よりも「administrative officer」の訳の方が良いと思います。文法を修正しました。
sen.e: Saigokusuji-gundai, an administrative officer as well as a local governor who managed the affairs of Kyushu region which was the territory under the direct control of the Tokugawa shogunate, had a fief of 162,000 koku.

sen.j: 代官所は豊後国日田（大分県日田市）に置かれた。
sen.e: The magistrate's office was placed in Hita, Bungo Province (Hita City, Oita Prefecture).
The magistrate's office was placed in Hita, Bungo Province (Hita City, Oita Prefecture).
The magistrate's office was placed in Hita, Bungo Province (Hita City, Oita Prefecture).

sen.j: 西国筋郡代が所轄する天領は全国の天領のうち2位という大きさである。
sen.e: The tenryo (the shogunal demesne) under the responsibility of Saigokusuji-gundai was the second largest tenryo among the tenryo in Japan.
The tenryo (the shogunal demesne) under the responsibility of Saigokusuji-gundai was the second largest tenryo among the tenryo in the nation.
The tenryo (the shogunal demesne) under the responsibility of Saigokusuji-gundai was the second largest tenryo among the tenryo in the nation.

sen.j: また接することの多い島津氏、細川氏、鍋島氏、黒田氏という外様雄藩との関係から通常の代官より格上の郡代とされた。
sen.e: Saigokusuji-gundai was regarded as the higher position than other regular gundai because it had close relationship with tozama yuhan (outside feudal lord of powerful domain), such as the Shimazu clan, the Hosokawa clan, the Nabeshima clan, and the Kuroda clan.

Saigokusuji-gundai was regarded as the higher position than other regular gundai because it had close relationship with tozama yuhan (outside feudal lord of powerful domain), such as the Shimazu clan, the Hosokawa clan, the Nabeshima clan, and the Kuroda clan.

Saigokusuji-gundai was regarded as the higher position than other regular gundai because it had close relationship with tozama yuhan (outside feudal lord of powerful domain), such as the Shimazu clan, the Hosokawa clan, the Nabeshima clan, and the Kuroda clan.

sen.j: その任務は長崎奉行と協力して九州諸藩の動静監視であり「九州探題」とも呼ばれた。
sen.e: Since their job was to watch developments in the Kyushu domains, cooperating with Nagasaki bugyo (Nagasaki magistrates), they were also known as "Kyushu Tandai" (local feudal commissioner).
Since their job was to watch developments in the Kyushu domains, cooperating with Nagasaki bugyo (Nagasaki magistrate), they were also known as "Kyushu Tandai" (local feudal commissioner).
sen.cmt: 長崎奉行は単数形にしました。
sen.e: Since their job was to watch developments in the Kyushu domains, cooperating with Nagasaki bugyo (Nagasaki magistrate), they were also known as "Kyushu Tandai" (local feudal commissioner).
